stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on visual polish for the main overworld: adding the first pass of shaders, creating a dynamic fog system that makes the far side fade to white, and introducing new bouncing "grape" actors. The stream was largely about iterative tweaking, bug-fixing, and small asset creation.

development_findings.summary: Old levels have broken since recent engine updates, so the team is now revisiting and fixing them to restore playability.
development_findings.quote: These old levels are going to become a lot more playable soon because we broke them over time with engine updates.

development_findings.summary: The immediate milestone is finishing the first round of shaders in the overworld.
development_findings.quote: The goal of today's stream [is to] finish the first round of adding shaders to this.

development_findings.summary: Kaze built a position-based fog controller so the overworld fades to white only after the player crosses the bridge, preventing unwanted fog in nearby areas.
development_findings.quote: Clearly the fog can't start here because if it did then this would be white when the rest of the stage has no fog.

development_findings.summary: Decal rendering has recently become unreliable; identifying and correcting this regression is on the task list.
development_findings.quote: We have a lot of issues with decals now for some reason; we didn't used to have those issues.

development_findings.summary: He intends to strip textures, remove NPCs, and possibly auto-move Mario in the overworld to convey a desolate atmosphere.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking the entire world should just be dead… I think Mario should move automatically so you don't even have to play the game here.

development_findings.summary: A new "grape" actor was modeled with prim-color shading, collision, bounce physics and a squishy sound, to serve as individual platform objects.
development_findings.quote: I like the grapes. They're good grapes.

development_findings.summary: All engine 'loops' are being rewritten as 'ticks' for cleaner frame-based updates.
development_findings.quote: We're removing all loops, by the way—turning all of them into ticks.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wants a one-click export script that can package the entire repository automatically.
development_findings.quote: I want to get my repository into a state where I can execute a script to export every[thing].

context_findings.summary: Kaze works an external job, limiting streams to days off.
context_findings.quote: Tomorrow I definitely will not be able to stream because I have my job.

context_findings.summary: He expresses strong opinions on design: dislikes forced complexity (e.g., analog dead-zones, Pokémon combat) and favors clean, intuitive mechanics.
context_findings.quote: If you think about it, competitive Pokémon… at its core is a math optimization problem, and who enjoys those?

context_findings.summary: He rejects cannabis use and jokes about mind-control conspiracy theories, revealing a playful but opinionated personality.
context_findings.quote: Oh you definitely should stop smoking pot. Pot is no good.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s worldview is materialistic; he explicitly states he doesn't believe in consciousness as a distinct phenomenon.
context_findings.quote: I don't believe in consciousness, so that question makes no sense.

zeina.summary: Zeina is currently producing assets for "Penguin Town," Course 13.
zeina.quote: She's currently still working on the Penguin Town for course 13.

key_stories.title: Overworld Fog Fade
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed the beach area to stay clear while the distant ship faded into white. Initial fog settings blanketed everything, so he wrote a custom fog controller tied to player position and tuned the start distance (≈13 000 units) until the effect felt natural.
key_stories.challenge: Create a localized white-out effect without covering the near beach in fog.
key_stories.process: Implemented a scriptable fog controller, experimented with start distances and alpha bias, and repeatedly recompiled and tested.
key_stories.outcome: The fade now looks "kind of cool" and will be refined further with matching fog on distant geometry.
key_stories.key_quote: I think we could program the fog controller to make no fog at all appear while you're on this side and then when you're on the other side fog appears.

key_stories.title: Building the Grapes
key_stories.summary: Wanting interactive scenery, Kaze modeled individual grapes that Mario can bounce on. He defined their shape, prim-color shading, collision, and added a squishy grass-cut sound.
key_stories.challenge: Design a small, reusable platform object that feels playful and visually consistent.
key_stories.process: Modeled a spherical mesh, set prim-color multiply shading, added collision and a new actor definition, then tested sound and bounce.
key_stories.outcome: Grapes are in-game and Kaze is satisfied with their look and feel.
key_stories.key_quote: I like the grapes. They're good grapes.
